org.chronos.chronodb.api.query

Interface Condition

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    NegatedCondition, NegatedNumberCondition, NegatedStringCondition, NumberCondition, StringCondition
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCondition, ContainsCondition, EndsWithCondition, EqualsCondition, GreaterThanCondition, GreaterThanOrEqualToCondition, LessThanCondition, LessThanOrEqualToCondition, MatchesRegexCondition, NotContainsCondition, NotEndsWithCondition, NotEqualsCondition, NotMatchesRegexCondition, NotStartsWithCondition, StartsWithCondition

    public interface Condition
    A condition is a comparison operation to be applied inside a WhereElement in the query language.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static EqualsCondition EQUALS
      Standard equality condition.
      static NotEqualsCondition NOT_EQUALS
      Inverted equality condition.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean acceptsEmptyValue()
      Checks if this condition accepts the empty value.
      java.lang.String getInfix()
      Returns the in-fix representation of this condition.
      default boolean isNegated()
      Checks if this condition is negated or not.
      Condition negate()
      Returns the negated form of this condition.
      static java.util.List<Condition> values()
      Returns the list of all known Conditions (excluding instances of subclasses).

    • Field Detail

      • EQUALS

        static final EqualsCondition EQUALS
        Standard equality condition.

      • NOT_EQUALS

        static final NotEqualsCondition NOT_EQUALS
        Inverted equality condition.

    • Method Detail

      • values

        static java.util.List<Condition> values()
        Returns the list of all known Conditions (excluding instances of subclasses).
        Returns:
        The list of known conditions. Never null.

      • negate

        Condition negate()
        Returns the negated form of this condition.

        This also works for already negated conditions. The following statement is always true: 

         condition.getNegated().getNegated() == condition // always true
        Returns:
        The negated condition. For already negated conditions, the regular non-negated condition will be returned.

      • isNegated

        default boolean isNegated()
        Checks if this condition is negated or not.
        Returns:
        true if this is a negated condition, otherwise false.

      • acceptsEmptyValue

        default boolean acceptsEmptyValue()
        Checks if this condition accepts the empty value.
        Returns:
        true if this condition accepts the empty value, otherwise false.

      • getInfix

        java.lang.String getInfix()
        Returns the in-fix representation of this condition.
        Returns:
        The in-fix representation. Never null.
